qas.question: What did al-Gama'a al-Islamiyya use to get its way?
Over 100 Egyptian police were victims of what group's campaign of terror?
How did the Islamic Group's campaign to overthrow the government turn out?
When did Jamaa Islamiya renounce violence?
Who has the Islamic Liberation Party attempted to assassinate?
What did al-Gama'a al-Islamiyya use to not get its way?
Over 300 Egyptian police were victims of what group's campaign of terror?
How did the Islamic Group's campaign to support the government turn out?
When did Jamaa Islamiya accept violence?
Who has the Islamic Liberation Party never attempted to assassinate?

context: Another of the Egyptian groups which employed <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>violence<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> in their struggle for Islamic order was <a1_0><a1_1><b6_0>al-Gama'a al-Islamiyya<b6_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/> (<a1_2>Islamic Group<a1_2/>). Victims of their campaign against the Egyptian state in the 1990s included the head of the counter-terrorism police (Major General Raouf Khayrat), a parliamentary speaker (Rifaat al-Mahgoub), dozens of European tourists and Egyptian bystanders, and over 100 Egyptian police. Ultimately the campaign to overthrow the government was <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>unsuccessful<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, and the major jihadi group, Jamaa Islamiya (or al-Gama'a al-Islamiyya), renounced violence <a3_0>in <a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>2003<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. Other lesser known groups include the Islamic Liberation Party, Salvation from Hell and Takfir wal-Hijra, and these groups have variously been involved in activities such as attempted assassinations of <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>political figures<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, arson of video shops and attempted takeovers of government buildings.
